transportAdvice: Fort-de-France is partially walkable in the city center, though the hilly terrain and spread-out attractions make taxis and rental cars the most practical options for exploring the island; a public bus network connects the city to surrounding towns and beaches, though schedules can be infrequent. Taxis are widely available but relatively expensive, and renting a car is recommended for visitors who want to explore beyond the capital.

weather.description: January is one of the driest and most pleasant months, with warm sunny days and comfortable evenings.
February remains dry and sunny, making it an excellent time to visit beaches and explore the island.
March sees slightly warmer temperatures with continued dry conditions and plenty of sunshine.
April marks the transition toward the wet season, with occasional showers beginning to appear alongside warm weather.
May brings increasing humidity and more frequent afternoon showers as the wet season begins to establish itself.
June is notably wetter and more humid, with regular rainfall and the start of the Atlantic hurricane season.
July remains firmly in the wet season with frequent heavy showers, though rain often comes in short bursts.
August is one of the hottest and wettest months, with elevated hurricane risk and high humidity throughout.
September is the peak of hurricane season and among the rainiest months, with persistent heat and humidity.
October remains wet and warm as the hurricane season continues, though storm frequency begins to ease toward month's end.
November sees a gradual transition out of the wet season, with decreasing rainfall but still warm and humid conditions.
December returns to drier, more comfortable conditions, making it a popular time for visitors seeking pleasant tropical weather.
